ygData.messageBody:
WRONG! the rules still apply. if the necro is doing more damage than his pet
(DoT spells will do more) the mob will turn on him. that constant throughout
all of EQ
-----Original Message-----
From: James Dwyer <jdwar@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, May 28, 1999 10:47 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] GZ Verant guy replies to some of wizard questions


>From: James Dwyer <jdwar@...>
>
>Bah! But the necro has the pet that will last for almost 45 seconds. So
>no damage taken by necro, and he can choose to run should it get close,
>and most likely get away. All he lost is? Time, and 1 sp (bone chips)
>Whereas wizard can't cast anymore as that 15 seconds got the mob right
>on ya and pissed as all Plane of Hate.
>
>Plus, if wizards were balanced against all magi, and they are improving
>other magi, then you have an unbalance starting. Also, it has been shown
>that Verant hasn't spent much time balancing the higher levels. Who
>knows whats going to happen?
>
>Croesus Illuminatus (Xegony)
>

>> > - Wizards have a experience diminution I don't know how much for

>>
>> > - Wizards are very weak at start and at lv 20 start to be traveler

>>
>> > - Wizard combat definition is major damage in shortest time!
>> > - Enchanter goes with more suptile tactic with pet, weaking enemy or
>> charming
>>
>> An Enchanter can weaken, but has a hard time doing damage.
>>
>> > - necromancer rely on his strong pet and Damage Over Time
>> spells DOT where he is a master this spells do in time much more

>> True - over time, a necro does more. For him to do the damage
>> that you do in 15 seconds, he would need 1 min. Even if his mana to
